metadata.title: CVE-2024-50287 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:media: v4l2-tpg: prevent the risk of a division by zeroAs reported by Coverity, the logic at tpg_precalculate_line()blindly rescales the buffer even when scaled_witdh is equal tozero. If this ever happens, this will cause a division by zero.Instead, add a WARN_ON_ONCE() to trigger such cases and returnwithout doing any precalculation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-50287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required
